citation.article-title: Clostridium neopropionicum sp. nov., a strict anaerobic bacterium fermenting ethanol to propionate through acrylate pathway.

p.s: Description of Clostridium neopropionicum sp. nov.
Clostridium neopropionicum (neo.pro.pi.o'ni.cum neos, Gr. adj. new; acidum propionicum, M.L.n. propionic acid; neopropionicum a new propionic acid producing Clostridium)
Cells in broth cultures strained gram-negative.

Strain X4 is slightly motile by one side-inserted flagellum, sporeforming, strictly anaerobic, with straight rods (0.5 to 0.6 by 1.4 to 3 µm) with tapered ends that occur singly, in pair most of the time or occasionally in short chains.
Ageing cultures form large, subterminal, deforming, oval spores (0.7 by 0.9 µm in size).
Ethanol fermented to propionate, acetate, propanol and butyrate.
Threonine, β-alanine, glucose, are fermented to propionate, acetate and butyrate, L-cysteine, L- and D-alanine, L-serine to propionate and acetate.
Selective enrichment in freshwater medium with ethanol as substrate, pH-range: 6.1-8.1, temperature range 15-40 °C, optimum: 30 °C.
DNA base ratio from thermal denaturation: 34.5 ± 0.5% guanine plus cytosine.
DSM 3847, deposited at: Deutsche Sammlung für Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
